detailsOfAchievement: 1-200 Minority Women achieved Leadership Development Training Program in Block- Baghauli , District- Sant Kabir Nagar (U.P.) for year 2015-16 and 127 Minority women in year 2013-14 under ministry of minority affairs New Delhi. 2- We are Working for the welfare of Persons with Autism, Cerebral Palsy, Mental Retardation and Multiple Disabilities under The National Trust (Ministry of Social Justice & Empowerment, Government of India) The National Trust offered us set up cost for early Intervention and School Readiness Scheme DISHA, Group home for Adults GHARAUNDA, Day Care Centre VIKAAS. Organisation has implemented school program in Sarvoday Balram Vidyalay, Mehndawal, Sant Kabir Nagar on the occasion of World Down Syndrome Day on 21st March 2016 and one day workshop for ASHA, ANM , AGANBADI workers in chairmanship of Superintendent of CHC Mehndawal to sensitize people in regard to person with Disability (PWD) and encourage their inclusion in the society for Social Integration and Participation of persons with Disabilities in all aspects of life, covered under the National Trust Badhte Kadam Scheme. Organisation has started Gharaunda Group Homes since 15th March 2016. SVSSKS has organized a camp for Disability Registration Certificate of Mentally retired and other disabilities in Mehndawal on 31st March 2016 , in which 55 Disability Certificates has been provided. Other Programs- Femle SHG- 200 ,Bank linkges- 60 Livelihood Promotion- Dairy form- 30 SHG, Goatry and Piggery- 20 SHG, Kirana shopa- 2, Agricultural Activities- 6 SHG. Targeted Intervention Project for 400 FSW, 100 MSM, 100 IDUs in Collaboration with UPSACS - Behaviour change communication, Condom Promotion, STI treament, ICTC, Health camps and Community events are Launched with them, Pulse Polio Immunization Programe Established 5 Agro Service Centres under SDTT Project. NEAC - 2 Blocks, Vocationally Trained- 200 Female. Vermi Compostinkg - 5, Matka khad- 5, CPP- 3, Nodep - 5.

detailsOfAchievement: The Goat Trust is a shared dream of development professionals who have had extensive experience in different geographies and with different communities. It is extract of all such knowledge of having worked with marginalized and under-privileged communities. Idea to promote TGT was to consolidate and accentuate efforts to make small livestock based livelihoods a decent and remunerative professional by poor women headed families. There was a felt need to understand and address issues and challenges of small livestock (Goat/sheep/pig/birds) farmers and bring it at the center of development debate. Focus is to promote action research in partnership mode to undertake and share the learning generated amongst different stakeholders.

detailsOfAchievement: The Intelligent Indian has successfully engaged with more than 20000 young people across India to bridge the crucial need for expansion of education, training and employment opportunities and prepare them as leaders for tomorrow. This has been possible through organising several in-person and virtual capacity building workshops, vocational internships and community development advocacy programs in the field of gender equality, quality education, menstrual hygiene, and environment sustainability.
